category_summary:
AI capabilities in scientific research dominated today's high-value discussions. A notable report highlights **AI solving three Erdős mathematical problems** in just 3 days, illustrating a pattern of rapid progression from near-misses to genuine breakthroughs in hard technical domains.

- **Ethan Mollick** shared a creative AI application [reimagining **T.S. Eliot's The Wasteland**](/?date=2026-01-12&category=social#item-09e93465fe53) as an ASCII roguelike game with tarot mechanics
- **Simon Willison** [provided technical follow-up](/?date=2026-01-12&category=social#item-b22d28b972b0) on his JustHTML project, demonstrating continued activity in the AI-adjacent developer tooling space
- Community members [built on Willison's work with **snippethost**](/?date=2026-01-12&category=social#item-8a635610f13a), showing healthy ecosystem collaboration around developer infrastructure
category_summary_html:
AI capabilities in scientific research dominated today's high-value discussions. A notable report highlights AI solving three Erdős mathematical problems in just 3 days, illustrating a pattern of rapid progression from near-misses to genuine breakthroughs in hard technical domains.

  • Ethan Mollick shared a creative AI application reimagining T.S. Eliot's The Wasteland as an ASCII roguelike game with tarot mechanics
  • Simon Willison provided technical follow-up on his JustHTML project, demonstrating continued activity in the AI-adjacent developer tooling space
  • Community members built on Willison's work with snippethost, showing healthy ecosystem collaboration around developer infrastructure

themes.name: AI in Scientific Discovery
themes.description: AI systems achieving breakthroughs in mathematical and scientific research, demonstrating capability progression from near-misses to genuine solutions

themes.name: AI Creativity & Generative Applications
themes.description: Using AI to generate creative content such as game concepts and literary adaptations

themes.name: Developer Tools & Infrastructure
themes.description: Web development tools and ecosystem projects, tangentially related to AI tooling community

items.title: One very familiar pattern in AI and science right now is going from a lot of false starts on hard ta...
items.content:
One very familiar pattern in AI and science right now is going from a lot of false starts on hard tasks (there have been near-misses where AI appears to solve an Erdos problem but just finds an old solution no one knew about) to actually doing the thing soon after.

Three Erdos problems in 3 days.
items.author: @emollick.bsky.social
items.summary: As first reported in [Social](/?date=2026-01-10&category=social#item-ca51c47a532d) earlier this week, Reports that AI has solved three Erdős mathematical problems in 3 days, noting a pattern where AI goes from near-misses to genuine breakthroughs in hard scientific tasks.
items.reasoning: High-impact observation about AI capabilities in mathematical research from a credible source. Strong engagement (108 likes, 17 reposts/quotes). Original insight about the pattern of AI progress in science. Significant milestone in AI-for-science.

continuation.original_title: Milestone in AI tools applied to Erdos problems, with GPT-5.2 Pro:
continuation.reference_text: As first reported in **Social** earlier this week

items.summary_html: As first reported in Social earlier this week, Reports that AI has solved three Erdős mathematical problems in 3 days, noting a pattern where AI goes from near-misses to genuine breakthroughs in hard scientific tasks.
items.content_html:
One very familiar pattern in AI and science right now is going from a lot of false starts on hard tasks (there have been near-misses where AI appears to solve an Erdos problem but just finds an old solution no one knew about) to actually doing the thing soon after.

Three Erdos problems in 3 days.

items.content: Eliot's the Wasteland as ASCII rogue game, with a mechanic where you collect fragments and use Madame Sosostris's Tarot cards as you pass through Burial in the Unreal City, Fire, Water, and Thunder to find the Fisher King.

items.content: When I wrote about my JustHTML port from Python to JavaScript last month I chickened out and finished the post with some open questions - I've now made an attempt at providing my own answers to those questions here: simonwillison.net/2026/Jan/11/...
